i found some hits with google, but nothing very helpful
Which CD did you install from?
i don't think i've reinstalled this box since debian 0.93 or something like that :-)
er, yesterday or the day before
That problem ought to have been fixed as of yesterday afternoon. =)
will have to try it the next time i reboot
The trick now is to upgrade your initramfs-tools to 0.23, and then regenerated the initramfs.
You can either do that through apt-get --reinstall the kernel, or just mkinitramfs -o /boot/initrd.img-2.6.10-7-686 2.6.10-7-686  (Substituting the appropriate version for your setup)
No prob.  Please ping me if you have further problems.
